fields.descriptive_line: Stipple engraving by Lambert Antoine Claessens; portrait of Jean Rabaut St. Étienne.
fields.physical_description: Portrait, lettered with sitter's, artist's names etc.
fields.title: Jean Rabaut St. Étienne (1743-1793) Deputy.  (BN:Vinck 6450); Pictures of the French Revolution; Tafereelen van de Staatsomwenteling in Frankrijk
fields.location: Prints & Drawings Study Room, level D, case 94, shelf C, box 26
Prints & Drawings Study Room, level D

fields.name: Prints & Drawings Study Room, level D

fields.bibliography: Victoria and Albert Museum Department of Prints and Drawings and Department of Paintings Accessions 1953 London: HMSO, 1963 The full text of the entry is as follows: "CLAESSENS, Lambert Antoine (1763-1834) Portraits (51, and 1 duplicate) engraved by L. A. Claessens after various artists, forming part of an edition, published by Johannes Noman, Zaltbommel, 1824-5, of Tafereelen van de Staatsomwenteling in Frankrijk [Pictures of the French Revolution], first published in 25 parts by Johannes Allart, Amsterdam, 1795-1801. (BN:Vinck 1350) In six volumes, bound in decorative paper, in a slip-case. Each lettered with sitter's, artists' names etc. Stipple engravings. E.258, 261, 263-265, 267, 268, 270, 272, 274, 275, 279, 281, 282, 284-287, 289-291, 294-296, 300, 301, 306-308, 311, 313-315, 317, 319, 322, 323, 326, 328, 330, 333, 335, 337, 340, 342, 344, 347, 349, 351, 354-356-1953 Note: For other plates from this edition see FLUCHS, C., PORTMAN, L. G. and VINKELES, R. Louis XVI, (1754-1793). After J. Bose. (BN:Vinck 614) E.258-1953 Jacques Necker (1732-1804), financier and statesman. After J. S. Duplessis. [Not in BN:Vinck] E.261-1953 Marie Antoinette (1755-1793). After an engraving by John Curtis of Dufroe's copy of painting by Vigée-Lebrun. (Gower 84; BN:Vinck 613) E.263-1953 Jean SilvainBailly (1736-1793), Deputy, Mayor of Paris. After an engraving by S. C. Miger after L. S. Boizot. (BN:Vinck 1838) E.264-1953 Honoré Riqueti, Count of Mirabeau (1749-1791). After an engraving by G. Fiesinger after J. Guérin. (BN:Vinck 1904) E.265-1953 Marie Joseph Motier, Marquis of La Fayatte (1757-1834). After an engraving by G. Fiesinger after J. Guérin. (BN:Vinck 1782) E.267-1953 Claude Fauchet (1744-1793), Constitutional Bishop of Le Calvados, Deputy. After an engraving by J.-B. Vérité. (BN:Vinck 3505) E.268-1953 Isaac Le Chapelier (1754-1794), Deputy. (BN:Vinck 2667) E.270-1953 Armand Camus (1740-1804), Deputy. (BN:Vinck 3472) E.272-1953 Count Emmanuel Sieyès (1748-1836), Abbé, one of the Directors. (BN:Vinck 2686) E.274-1953 Jean Rewbell (1747-1807), one of the Directors. (BN:Vinck 2684) E.275-1953 Trophime, Marquis of Lally-Tollendal (1751-1830), Deputy. (BN:Vinck 2675) E.279-1953 Stanlislas, Count of Clermont-Tonnerre (1757-1792), Deputy, (BN:Vinck 2668) E.281-1953 Armand de Vignerot du Plessis de Richelieu, Duke of Aiguillon (1761-1800), Deputy. After an engraving by J.-B. Vérité. (BN:Vinck 2978) E.282-1953 Antoine Barnave (1761-1793), President of the National Assembly. (BN:Vinck 4032) E.284-1953 Cardinal Jean Maury (1746-1817), Napoleonic Archbishop of Paris. After the plaster bust by J.-B. Stouf, exhibited at the Salon, 1787. (BN:Vinck 1980) E.285-1953 Alexandre, Count of Lameth (1760-1829), Deputy. After an engraving by G. Fiesinger after J. Guérin. (BN:Vinck 3580) E.286-1953 Henri Grégoire (1750-1831), Constitutional Bishop of Blois. (BN:Vinck 2673) E.287-1953 Francois, Duke of Montesquiou-Fezensac (1756-1832), Abbot of Beaulieu, President of the National Assembly. (BN:Vinck 4525) E.289-1953 Jean-Baptiste du Val-de-Grâce, Baron of Cloots (Anacharsis Cloots) (1755-1794). (BN:Vinck 6252) E.290-1953 Jean Rabaut St. Étienne (1743-1793) Deputy. (BN:Vinck 6450) E.291-1953 Marguerite Louis Duport-Dutertre (1754-1793), Minister of Justice to Louis XVI. (BN:Vinck 2671) E.297-1953 Charles, Count of Lameth (1757-1832), Deputy. After an engraving by G. Fiesinger after J. Guérin. (BN:Vinck 3586, another state) E.295-1953 Benjamin Franklin (1706-1790). [Not in BN:Vinck] E.296-1953 Charles de Talleyrand-Périgord, Prince of Benevento (1754-1838), Bishop of Autun. After an engraving by J.-B. Vérité. (BN:Vinck 3029) E.300-1953 Alexandre, Viscount of Beauharnais (1760-1794), Deputy. [Not in BN:Vinck] E.301-1953 Jérôme Petion de Villeneuve (1756-1794), Mayor of Paris, (BN:Vinck 2682, 4053) E.306-1953 Jean Roland de La Platière (1734-1793), Minister of the Interior to Louis XVI. (BN:Vinck 2683) E.307-1953 Jacques Thouret (1746-1794), Deputy. (BN:Vinck 2687) E.308-1953 Louis, Duke of Orleans (1747-1793) (called Philippe Égalité). (BN:Vinck 2680) E.311-1953 Jacques Brissot (1754-1793) (called de Warville), Deputy. (BN:Vinck 6198) E.313-1953 Étienne Clavière (1735-1793), financier and politician. (BN:Vinck 6204) 2 impressions. E.314, 315-1953 Pierre, Baron Malouet (1740-1812), Deputy. (BN:Vinck 2677) E.317-1953 Nicholas Luckner (1722-1794), Marshal of France. (BN:Vinck 7080) E.319-1953 Pierre Vergniau (1754-1793), Deputy. (BN:Vinck 6213) E.322-1953 Louis Manuel (1751-1793), Deputy. (BN:Vinck 2678) E.323-1953 François Kellerman, Duke of Valmy (1735-1820), Marshal of France. After an engraving by Sandos after F. Bonneville. (BN:Vinck 7068) E.326-1953 George Danton (1759-1794). (BN:Vinck 2670, 6267) E.328-1953 Joseph Servan de Gerby (1741-1808), General. (BN:Vinck 7100) E.330-1953 Joseph Cambon (1754/6-1820), member of the Convention. (BN:Vinck 2665) E.333-1953 Louis Mercier (1740-1814), Deputy, member of Council of Five Hundred. (BN:Vinck 2679) E.335-1953 Adam, Count of Custine (1740-1793), General. (BN:Vinck 6189) E.337-1953 Armand Kersaint (1742-1793), Vice-Admiral, Deputy. (BN:Vinck 2674) E.340-1953 Guy Target (1733-1807), Deputy. (BN:Vinck 4345) E.342-1953 Chrétien de Lamoignon de Malesherbes (1721-1794), former Minister of State, Counsel for Louis XVI. (BN:Vinck 5088) E.344-1953 Joseph Challier (1747-1793), revolutionary leader of Lyons. (BN:Vinck 2666, 5405) E.347-1953 Charles Dumourier (1739-1823), General. (BN:Vinck 4667) E.349-1953 Auguste Picot, Marquis of Dampierre (1756-1793), General. After an engraving by Sandos after F. Bonneville. (BN:Vinck 7036) E.351-1953 Jean de Lacrois (1754-1794), President of the Convention. (BN:Vinck 6206) E.354-1953 Jean Marat (1743-1793), Deputy, publisher of L'Ami du Peuple. (BN:Vinck 5275) E.355-1953 (Marie Anne) Charlotte Corday d'Armont (1768-1793. (BN:Vinck 5365) E.356-1953"
